pullRequest.body:
PR inspired by "automated bugs" (#12054).

[Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/automated.20bugs/near/432861117)

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: :v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8666802066/job/23768411275)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8666802066/job/23768411520)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8666802066/job/23768410924)

I think this is too strong (it does whnf at default transparency).

I'm not sure about doing reduction (I know @fpvandoorn is not sold on doing whnf before matching). There's also `cleanupAnnotations (← instatiateMVars (← goal.getType))`.

In the following code snippet, I would indeed hope that `abel_nf` doesn't unfold the definition of `MyTrue`.
```lean
def MyTrue := True
example : MyTrue := by
  abel_nf
```
(The similar thing I mainly dislike is matching at semireducible transparency).
It should unfold it if it is `@[reducible]` though, right?
Would `← whnfR (← instantiateMVars (← goal.getType))` and then guard-messaging the test suggested by Floris as an error be a solution with which everyone is happy?

Watch out, whnfR has to occur before instantiateMVars.

Better I think would be withReducible around the current code. (With getType')

Kyle, assuming that
```lean
  let tgt ← Lean.Meta.withReducible (instantiateMVars (← goal.getType'))
```
is the change that you suggested, then Floris' example actually gets solved by `abel_nf`.

Sorry, I made a mistake with what I wrote, I wrote it on my phone. You need to be careful with `withReducible` and `←` lifting. The `getType'` function incidentally doesn't need `instantiateMVars`, so with that simplification, the correct version should be
```lean
  let tgt ← withReducible goal.getType'
```
Thanks Kyle: I used your latest version and it passes the tests, both successfully and not!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: mdata in abel
